
Intercepted secret was encrypted with RSA using a blum integer modulus. Can you exploit this flaw to recover the original message? Ciphertext: 2789765656858607943119697790274614323234343916405980635984778454377822403664989722724369525277060866892006093961034282291224061092641226694803984500889326

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{sam6yl1w}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2789765656858607943119697790274614323234343916405980635984778454377822403664989722724369525277060866892006093961034282291224061092641226694803984500889326
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6671923552434838686772548505782136329989810492534415035401799949028050207443369520916434138027678198090810322343517587443948142589272367956631107614273141, e=698542281379615212343069274248738769610517729851076098099001278431964291295883439895050905215843868569998445020479860465833080064124664018265555228246169
The lower 104 bits of p are: 11883803802578383380329948125882866991

extra_info: p=76337406458665274556118937494992797356017579781005040230139845743353194732847, q=87400448377133590779161008803166283822920965410273952075354297946767153851803, Ï†(n)=6671923552434838686772548505782136329989810492534415035401799949028050207443205783061598339162342918144512163262338648898756863596966873812940987265688492
